data: OB Fetal Demise and / or Loss Greater than 13 Weeks (Multiphase) EKM
Only for use by Obstetrics or by GP-Obstetrics
Nurse to initiate the Induction of Labour phase of this plan
q1h, when in active labour or on oxytocin
q1h for patients on opioids, notify provider if level of consciousness decreases
When delivery has not occurred by 24 hours of start of induction, in person assessment by MRP is required
If placenta retained for more than 2 hours post-delivery of fetus
Prepare for 18 French single 30 mL balloon intracervical foley catheter including up to 60 mL of sterile water to be introduced into intracervical canal under sterile technique by provider
Leave intracervical foley catheter in place until it falls out spontaneously OR 24 hours elapsed
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order

once, before breakfast when tolerating diet. If not staying overnight, instruct patient to test at home before breakfast and call MD if greater than 6 mmol/L. If unable to test at home, have provider to arrange a GTT at 6 to 12 weeks post delivery
